original_text:
Ashoka
A nostra memoria, nessuno ha mai dedicato una slot ad Ashoka il Grande, personaggio leggendario sovrano dell’impero Maurya, conquistatore del subcontinente indiano, di parte della Persia e di altri territori, capace di convertire la sua popolazione al buddismo.
A colmare questa lacuna ci ha pensato la Elk, con una slot dall’impatto visivo molto interessante e un gameplay che conquista sin dal primo Spin.
La griglia di grandi dimensioni si trova all’interno di una foresta, davanti a due statue, una di un teschio, l’altra di Kali, divinità con quattro braccia dea della morte.
Il colore predominante è il grigio-verde opaco, ma non per i simboli che invece sono brillanti e contrastano bene con tutto il resto.
La musica indiana di sottofondo ha ritmi moderni e accattivanti, ma è possibile disattivarla all’apertura del gioco o più vanti accedendo al menù.
 
Caratteristiche del gioco
La griglia molto grande, con 6 rulli e 8 righe, potrebbe accogliere 48 simboli ad ogni Spin, ma in realtà questo non succede quasi mai perché un numero variabile di posizioni resterà sempre vuoto. Il sistema di gioco è il cosiddetto Avalanche, quindi ogni volta che si ottiene una combinazione vincente, i simboli paganti vengono rimossi e le posizioni rimaste vuote vengono occupate da altri simboli. Questa funzione continua sino al primo Respin senza vincite. La puntata minima è di 0,20 € e per vincere è necessario ottenere almeno 8 simboli identici in qualsiasi punto della griglia, con una vincita massima stimata di ben 25.000 volte la scommessa.
La volatilità è alta, mentre il ritorno teorico al giocatore è del 94%.
 
Come si vince con Ashoka
In Ashoka abbiamo diverse tipologie di simboli. Le carte da gioco dal J all’asso hanno un basso valore, a meno che non si riesca a creare gruppi di almeno 10 – 15 simboli. A seguire troviamo le gemme colorate (blu, verde, arancione e rosso), mentre la statua della tigre bianca è il simbolo più remunerativo.
In Ashoka ci sono tre diversi Wild: uno regolare, uno di grandi dimensioni 2×2 o 3×3 e uno caricato, ossia ne compaiono 2 o 3 nella stessa posizione. Questi rimangono bloccati finché non si ottengono almeno 3 vincite. Il Wild ricopre sempre la funzione di Jolly, quindi andrà a sostituire qualsiasi simbolo eccetto quelli speciali. Inoltre, una combo vincente di soli Wild paga quanto il simbolo di valore maggiore.
La X alla sinistra della griglia ci avvisa quando sta per arrivare un moltiplicatore, introdotto dalla pietra verde, o un Super moltiplicatore, indicato su una pietra rossa.
Il teschio è invece il nostro Scatter e con 3 di essi si attivano 10 Free Drop, ossia giri gratuiti che possono essere riattivati con 3 ulteriori Scatter.

Domande Frequenti 
Ashoka funziona con ogni sistema operativo?

Sì, questa slot gira su qualsiasi device e con ogni sistema operativo, da IOS ad Android.



Quanti giri gratuiti posso vincere con gli Scatter?

Il numero di Free Spins è 10, ma con altri 3 Scatter durante la funzione Bonus si ottengono 5 ulteriori giri gratis.



Qual è il ritorno teorico al giocatore di Ashoka?

Ashoka ha un RTP pari al 94%.

raw_translation.response:
Introducing Ashoka, the legendary ruler of the Maurya Empire, conqueror of the Indian subcontinent and a man who converted his people to Buddhism. Finally, a slot game worthy of this great historical figure has been created by Elk. The visual impact is striking, with a large grid set in a forest, flanked by statues of the skull and Kali, the goddess of death. The predominant color is a matte grey-green, except for the symbols that are bright and contrast well with the background. The Indian music in the background is modern and captivating, and can be disabled in the settings.

The game features a massive grid with 6 reels and 8 rows that could potentially hold up to 48 symbols per spin, but in reality, a varying number of positions will remain empty. The game uses the Avalanche system, so every time you get a winning combination, the paying symbols are removed, and the empty positions are filled with new symbols. This function continues until the first respin without a win. The minimum bet is €0.20, and to win, you must get at least 8 identical symbols anywhere on the grid, with a maximum win estimated at 25,000 times the bet. The volatility is high, and the theoretical return to the player is 94%.

The symbols range from J to Ace cards, colored gems (blue, green, orange, and red), up to the tiger statue, which is the most rewarding. There are three wilds, one regular, one large (2x2 or 3x3), and a loaded one where 2 or 3 appear in the same position. These remain stuck until you get at least 3 wins. The wild always serves as a substitute for any symbol except the special ones. Moreover, a winning combination of only wilds pays the same as the highest value symbol. The X to the left of the grid warns you when a multiplier is coming, introduced by the green stone, or a super multiplier indicated on a red stone. Lastly, the skull is the scatter, and with 3 of them, you trigger 10 free drops that can be reactivated with 3 additional scatters.

Ashoka functions on any device and operating system from IOS to Android. The number of free drops is 10, but you can obtain 5 additional free spins with another 3 scatters during the bonus round. Ashoka has an RTP of 94%, so as an experienced gambler, you know what to expect from this exciting and rewarding slot game.

raw_translation.response:
Ashoka

In the world of online slot games, few have dedicated themselves to the legendary figure of Ashoka the Great, the sovereign of the Maurya Empire who conquered parts of the Indian subcontinent, Persia, and other territories, and converted his people to Buddhism. But fear not my fellow experienced gamblers, for Elk has filled this void with an exciting new slot game that pulls you in immediately.

The grid is set in a majestic forest with two statues of a skull and Kali, the four-armed goddess of death. The dominant color is a matte green-gray, but the symbols are brilliantly colorful, standing out against the background. The Indian-inspired music is catchy, but you have the option of turning it off.

The game boasts six reels and eight rows, with the potential for up to 48 symbols on a spin, but in reality, some positions will remain empty. The game operates on the avalanche system, where winning symbols are removed from the grid and replaced with new ones, continuing until there are no more winning combinations. The minimum bet is 0.20 €, and to win, you need at least 8 identical symbols anywhere on the grid, with a maximum potential win of 25,000 times your bet. The volatility is high, and the theoretical return to player is 94%.

The symbols in Ashoka range from low-paying cards to the white tiger statue, which is the most lucrative. The game also features three types of wilds: regular, large 2x2 or 3x3 wilds, and stacked wilds that appear in clusters and remain until there are at least three wins. The wild can substitute for any symbol except the special ones, and a winning combination of only wilds pays the same as the highest value symbol.

Keep an eye out for the green and red stones, which indicate a multiplier or a super multiplier. The scatter symbol is the skull, which triggers 10 free spins when there are 3 on the grid.  Getting 3 more scatters during the bonus round will award an additional 5 free spins.

Ashoka is available on all devices with any operating system, ensuring everyone can join in on the excitement. So try your luck with Ashoka and see if you can walk away with a huge win!

response.headline: Theme and Inspiration
response.content:
Ashoka, huh? Sounds like a brand of soap or a fancy yoga pose. But no, this online slot game is actually based on the legendary Indian emperor who ruled the Maurya Empire and converted his people to Buddhism. It's clear that Elk Studios put a lot of effort into bringing this great historical figure to life with their game.

The symbols in Ashoka are as diverse as the Indian subcontinent itself. From the boring old J to Ace cards, to the colorful gems, all the way up to the majestic tiger statue. And let's not forget about the music, which perfectly captures the vibe of Indian culture.

The visuals in Ashoka are just as impressive. The game is set in a lush forest, flanked by imposing statues of the skull and Kali. It's definitely an intense aura of death, but don't worry, you're just here to have fun and maybe win some cash. So put on your turban, and let's spin those reels!

The wild substitutes for any symbol except the special ones, and a combination of only wilds pays like the highest value symbol. The X to the left of the grid indicates when a multiplier is coming, introduced by the green stone, or a super multiplier indicated on a red stone. Lastly, the skull scatter triggers 10 free drops, which can be reactivated with another three scatters during the bonus round.
